newsitem.title: POLAND: SOCCER-POLAND'S SOCCER COACH PIECHNICZEK QUITS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-POLAND'S SOCCER COACH PIECHNICZEK QUITS.

text.p: Polish national soccer coach Antoni Piechniczek has resigned a week after his side lost 2-0 to England ending their chances of qualifying for next year's World Cup finals, PAP news agency reported on Saturday.
Deputy coach Krzysztof Pawlak will take over for the time being, PAP added.
The agency did not cite reasons for Piechniczek's decision but his coaching style, since taking over a year ago, has aroused controversy.
Critics accused him of constantly changing line-ups and ignoring Polish players with foreign clubs because they sometimes could not meet his training demands.
Grzegorz Lato, the most capped footballer in Polish soccer history, told soccer magazine Pilka Nozna before the latest defeat that the current squad lacked character under Piechniczek's rule.
During a first stint as national coach, Piechniczek led Poland to third place in the 1982 finals in Spain and into the finals in Mexico in 1986.
He later continued his career as coach of the national squads of Tunisia and the United Arab Emirates before his return to Poland's top soccer post.
